channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Jannik Sinner beats Alexander Zverev in 3 sets to win second Australian Open in a row
item.description: Jannik Sinner claimed his second consecutive Australian Open championship on Sunday, never facing a single break point and using his complete game to outplay and frustrate Alexander Zverev for a 6-3, 7-6 (4), 6-3 victory in the final.
item.content:encoded:
Jannik Sinner claimed his second consecutive Australian Open championship on Sunday, never facing a single break point and using his complete game to outplay and frustrate Alexander Zverev for a 6-3, 7-6 (4), 6-3 victory in the final.

(Image credit: Vincent Thian/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Want good luck this year? Try these Lunar New Year traditions from NPR readers
item.description: Each culture that celebrates the Lunar New Year has traditions passed down from generation to generation that are thought to bring good luck. NPR readers share theirs.
item.content:encoded: Each culture that celebrates the Lunar New Year has traditions passed down from generation to generation that are thought to bring good luck. NPR readers share theirs.
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Churches have a long history of being safe havens — for immigrants and others
item.description: For centuries, houses of worship have served as havens for people needing refuge — and, in recent decades, sanctuary from the U.S. government.
item.content:encoded:
For centuries, houses of worship have served as havens for people needing refuge — and, in recent decades, sanctuary from the U.S. government.

(Image credit: Jeff Haynes/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: International peacekeepers killed as fighting rages around eastern Congo's key city
item.description: Fighting with M23 rebels in eastern Congo has left at least 13 peacekeepers and foreign soldiers dead. M23 has made significant territorial gains in recent weeks, encircling the eastern city of Goma.
item.content:encoded:
Fighting with M23 rebels in eastern Congo has left at least 13 peacekeepers and foreign soldiers dead. M23 has made significant territorial gains in recent weeks, encircling the eastern city of Goma.

(Image credit: Moses Sawasawa)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump's Q&A on Air Force One goes from the plane's color to TikTok and Canada
item.description: President Donald Trump popped in to the plane's press cabin while flying from Las Vegas to Florida to share his thoughts since taking office in a 20-minute Q&A with reporters.
item.content:encoded:
President Donald Trump popped in to the plane's press cabin while flying from Las Vegas to Florida to share his thoughts since taking office in a 20-minute Q&A with reporters.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump wants Jordan and Egypt to accept more refugees to 'just clean out' Gaza
item.description: President Donald Trump said Saturday he'd like to see Jordan, Egypt and other Arab nations increase the number of Palestinian refugees they are accepting to "just clean out" the war-torn area.
item.content:encoded:
President Donald Trump said Saturday he'd like to see Jordan, Egypt and other Arab nations increase the number of Palestinian refugees they are accepting to "just clean out" the war-torn area.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: In Las Vegas, Trump once again pitches no taxes on tips
item.description: President Trump's pitch to stop taxing tips is popular with everyone -- except for economists.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's pitch to stop taxing tips is popular with everyone -- except for economists.

(Image credit: Ian Maule/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: Exclusive: White House in talks to have Oracle and U.S. investors take over TikTok
item.description: The aim is to place oversight control in the hands of American software company Oracle and other investors. Under federal law, TikTok must split apart from China, or face a nationwide ban.
item.content:encoded:
The aim is to place oversight control in the hands of American software company Oracle and other investors. Under federal law, TikTok must split apart from China, or face a nationwide ban.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Madison Keys wins her first-ever Grand Slam title against two-time defending champion
item.description: Madison Keys was a tennis prodigy, beating Serena Williams when she was just 14 years old, but had not won a grand slam title in her 15 year career.
item.content:encoded:
Madison Keys was a tennis prodigy, beating Serena Williams when she was just 14 years old, but had not won a grand slam title in her 15 year career.

(Image credit: Ng Han Guan)
item.dc:creator: Mansee Khurana

item.title: PEPFAR, the acclaimed anti-HIV program, faces loss of funds as part of U.S. aid pause
item.description: On Friday, a memorandum signed by Marco Rubio called for a 90-day cessation of foreign aid. That would likely put on hold the work of PEPFAR, the President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief.
item.content:encoded:
On Friday, a memorandum signed by Marco Rubio called for a 90-day cessation of foreign aid. That would likely put on hold the work of PEPFAR, the President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief.

(Image credit: Yevhenii Zavhorodnii/Global Images Ukraine via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Melody Schreiber
